str2: From epi and phaino; to shine upon, i.e. Become visible or known.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Darkness, either physical or moral. From the base of skia; shadiness, i.e. Obscurity.
Apparently a primary word; 'shade' or a shadow (darkness of error or an adumbration).
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
(a) I make straight, (b) met: I put in the right way, direct. From kata and euthuno; to straighten fully, i.e. direct.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
